info.title: SuperOffice Agent API v1
info.termsOfService: You must be an authorized user to access this API.

post.summary: Gets a TicketCategory object.

parameters.name: ticketCategoryId
parameters.description: The identifier of the TicketCategory object

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Optional comma separated list of properties to include in the result. Other fields are then nulled out to reduce payload size: "Name,department,category". Default = show all fields.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Convert string references and multi-language values into a specified language (iso2) code.

parameters.name: SO-Language
parameters.description: Convert string references and multi-language values into a specified language (iso2) code. Overrides Accept-Language value.

parameters.name: SO-Culture
parameters.description: Number, date formatting in a specified culture (iso2 language) code. Partially overrides SO-Language/Accept-Language value. Ignored if no Language set.

parameters.name: SO-TimeZone
parameters.description: Specify the timezone code that you would like date/time responses converted to.

parameters.name: SO-AppToken
parameters.description: The application token that identifies the partner app. Used when calling Online WebAPI from a server.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.TicketCategoryE.description:
This entity describes the meta data for a ticket category, and provides special operations on it.
<para />
Carrier object for TicketCategoryEntity.
Services for the TicketCategoryEntity Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.IListAgent">List Agent</see>.

TicketCategoryId.description: The id of the ticket category. (primary key)

ParentId.description: The parent category for this category. -1 if this is a toplevel category.

Name.description: The (short) name of this category. E.g. &apos;support&apos;.

Fullname.description: The fullname (compiled from parents&apos; names) for this category. E.g. &apos;norway/product A/support&apos;.

CategoryMaster.description: The user associated with this category.

Flags.description: A bitmask representing flags for this category.

DelegateMethod.description: An integer indicating the delegation method for this category.

ExternalName.description: The external name for this category, used for the customer frontend.

ClosingStatus.description: Determines the default status used in the GUI when creating a ticket

MsgClosingStatus.description: Determines the default status used in the GUI when adding a request to a ticket

AssignmentLag.description: Number of minutes we shall override the assignment if a customer sends consecutive messages to this category

ReplyTemplate.description: Reply template to merge with messages posted in this category

NotificationEmail.description: Comma separated list of addresses to notify when requests are redelegated to (unassigned) in this category.

DefaultTicketStatus.description: Default status for new tickets, if 0 then there is a fallback to a user-dependent value

DefaultMessageStatus.description: Default status for new messages, if 0 then there is a fallback to a user-dependent value

EffectiveReplyTemplateId.description: Id of reply template to merge into messages, whose ticket belongs to this category. Also takes into account 'Apply to subcategories' on parent categories. This is a calculated, readonly field.

ExtraFields.description:
Deprecated: Use {SuperOffice.CRM.Services.TicketCategoryEntity.CustomFields} instead.
Extra fields added to the carrier. This could be data from Plug-ins, the foreign key system, external applications, etc.

CustomFields.description:
Udef + Extra fields added to the carrier. Extra fields as defined by changes to database schema + user-defined fields as defined by admin.
Custom fields combines user defined fields and extra fields into one bucket. 
The individual {SuperOffice.CRM.Services.TicketCategoryEntity.ExtraFields} and <see cref="!:UserDefinedFields">UserDefinedFields</see> properties are deprecated in favor of this
combined collection.

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

MonStart.description: The work hour start for Mondays. Note that only the time part of the DateTime is used

MonStop.description: The work hour start for Mondays. Note that only the time part of the DateTime is used

TueStart.description: The work hour start for Tuesdays. Note that only the time part of the DateTime is used

TueStop.description: The work hour stop for Tuesdays. Note that only the time part of the DateTime is used

WedStart.description: The work hour start for Wednesdays. Note that only the time part of the DateTime is used

WedStop.description: The work hour stop for Wednesdays. Note that only the time part of the DateTime is used

ThuStart.description: The work hour start for Thursdays. Note that only the time part of the DateTime is used

ThuStop.description: The work hour stop for Thursdays. Note that only the time part of the DateTime is used

FriStart.description: The work hour start for Fridays. Note that only the time part of the DateTime is used

FriStop.description: The work hour stop for Fridays. Note that only the time part of the DateTime is used

SatStart.description: The work hour start for Saturdays. Note that only the time part of the DateTime is used

SatStop.description: The work hour stop for Saturdays. Note that only the time part of the DateTime is used

SunStart.description: The work hour start for Sundays. Note that only the time part of the DateTime is used

SunStop.description: The work hour stop for Sundays. Note that only the time part of the DateTime is used

NonDates.description: Dates which the escalation time should not be running. Note that only the day of the year (day and month) is used. So the year and time part is not used even if this is a DateTime. Exception - it IS possible to include a year here, for dates that should not repeat every year

SmsTo.description: If an sms should be sent when escalating, this field will contain the recipient email address.

SuperOffice.WebApi.v1.Carriers.ListCarri.description: SetDocumentTemplateStream: Store a document template from its stream. SuperOffice Password.description:
SuperOffice username:password are passed in Base64-encoded. 

You can also pass inn an unencoded ticket 7T:abc== with the HTTP Authenticate header.

SuperId Authentication.description:
SuperOffice SuperId OAuth implicit flow. 
You need to issue a request to the SuperId authorization URL
    https://online.superoffice.com/login/common/oauth/authorize?response_type=token
      &client_id=670734e0-4c5a-11e3-be9e-a171392e81db
      &redirect_uri=https://example.com/spa/

passing in the application id and redirect URL.

SuperId will log the user in, and redirect to the requested redirect URL with a #payload
containing the access token and claims. (The redirect URL must be registered with SuperId in advance)

   https://example.com/spa#access_token=8A%3aCust12227.AXRrCITpPBvQX3UbIohb
      &token_type=bearer
      &state=
      &expires_in=3600
      &ctx=Cust12227
      &netserver_url=https%3a%2f%2fsod.superoffice.com%2fCust12227%2fRemote%2fServices82%2f

You can take the #access_token value and pass it as the Authenticate HTTP header as a BEARER token.
